title: Ancestry of AI Expansion
description: Additional events to complete the AI timeline.

events.title: Leibniz Binary System
events.description: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz perfects binary arithmetic, the language of 0s and 1s that will one day speak for all machines.

events.title: The Difference Engine
events.description: Charles Babbage designs the first automatic mechanical calculator, dreaming of a machine that can crunch numbers without human error.

events.title: Pitts & McCulloch Neuron
events.description: The first mathematical model of a neural network.

events.title: Cybernetics
events.description: Norbert Wiener defines the study of control and communication in the animal and the machine.

events.title: Asimov's Three Laws
events.description: Science fiction lays the ethical groundwork for robotics before the technology even exists.

events.title: The Logic Theorist
events.description: Often called the first AI program, written by Newell, Shaw, and Simon to mimic human problem-solving skills.

events.title: ELIZA
events.description: Joseph Weizenbaum creates the first chatbot, demonstrating how easily humans attribute emotion to simple code.

events.title: Perceptrons Book
events.description: Minsky and Papert publish a critique of neural networks that inadvertently freezes funding for a decade (AI Winter).

events.title: Expert Systems
events.description: AI finds commercial success by mimicking the decision-making ability of a human expert in specific domains.

events.title: Backpropagation
events.description: Hinton and colleagues popularize the algorithm that allows neural networks to learn from their mistakes, ending the AI winter.

events.title: Deep Blue Defeats Kasparov
events.description: Brute force logic conquers human intuition in chess, a watershed moment for machine intelligence.

events.title: Watson Wins Jeopardy
events.description: IBM's Watson demonstrates that machines can understand natural language processing and nuance.

events.title: ImageNet Breakthrough
events.description: AlexNet smashes error rates in image recognition, proving the power of Deep Learning and GPUs.

events.title: AlphaGo Zero
events.description: AI teaches itself Go without human data, creating strategies alien to 3,000 years of human history.

events.title: GPT-3
events.description: OpenAI releases a language model so powerful it blurs the line between human and machine writing.

events.title: Generative Reality
events.description: AI moves beyond text to creating video, code, and virtual worlds, challenging the nature of creativity itself.
